metadata.synopsis: Mamzell Amira is worried about her missing escort. You get a chance to take the quest or deny it here. If you take it, she gives you a free session with the dapper drow.
metadata.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A,Go to 19; 80 and click on Mamzell Amira.

41.speaker: Mamzell Amira
41.text: It's a dwarf you crave, whip in hand. Go on - tell me I'm wrong.

48.speaker: Mamzell Amira
48.text: A weary traveller, battered and bruised. You come for sustenance. No - decadence.

3.speaker: Mamzell Amira
3.text: A mien cool as ice, yet eyes burning hot. Oh yes, I know your bliss:

86.speaker: Mamzell Amira
86.text: A sturdy dwarf, a leather whip. She gives - you receive. Or have I misjudged you?

24.speaker: Mamzell Amira
24.text: I thought as much. Those eyes tell a story. Punishment is your pleasure.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Not my first choice, but I wouldn't say no.

31.speaker: Mamzell Amira
31.text: Of course you wouldn't. Who can resist the pleasure of the strap, once leather meets flesh?

19.speaker: Mamzell Amira
19.text: Am I? Your eyes tell a story, sweeting. You crave more than pleasure - you crave penance.

59.speaker: Mamzell Amira
59.text: It's Ffion you seek - our 'Stern Librarian'. She isn't here today, alas - your penance must wait.

37.speaker: Mamzell Amira
37.text: Alas, Ffion - our 'Stern Librarian' - has recently passed on.

45.speaker: Mamzell Amira
45.text: Well - we've other ways to fill your void. A drink, for one. A pair of drow, for another. Choose your sin.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Will this 'Stern Librarian' of yours be back tomorrow?

51.speaker: Mamzell Amira
51.text: Sweeting, I'm no fortune-teller. If I had a crystal ball, I promise I'd already have consulted it.

43.speaker: Mamzell Amira
43.text: Truth is, Ffion's gone well missing. And my hands may be skilful, but they were not made to turn every last stone she might be hiding behind.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: You need help. Let me find Ffion for you.

88.speaker: Mamzell Amira
88.text: To service is my calling. Not to be served.

46.speaker: Mamzell Amira
46.text: *Sigh.* But I'd be a fool to say 'no'. The girl kept my coffers near overflowing.

70.speaker: Mamzell Amira
70.text: Two flights up, then turn right and right again. That's Ffion's pleasure room, Elminster's Library. Here - take the key.

84.speaker: Mamzell Amira
84.text: Two flights up, then turn right and right again. That's Ffion's pleasure room, Elminster's Library. Here's - oh, I've gone and lost the key.

39.speaker: Mamzell Amira
39.text: Well, you'll have to find your own way in. You're the resourceful sort, you'll figure it out.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: 'Elminster's Library?' People will get their thrills in the strangest of places...
20.context: NodeContext: 'there's no accounting for taste' - finds this absolutely bizarre as someone who knows Elminster

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Naoise's client turned into a mind flayer. I had to kill it.

27.speaker: Mamzell Amira
27.text: A mind flayer - here?! You mean Jara was -

57.speaker: Mamzell Amira
57.text: Hells. Naoise must be beside herself. Thank the Madam Sharess you were there to protect her.
57.context: NodeContext: Madam = reference to the demigod.

5.speaker: Mamzell Amira
5.text: Please - don't spread word of this. Sharess' Caress lives or dies by its reputation.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You have drow escorts on hand? That does sound tempting.

58.speaker: Mamzell Amira
58.text: Twins, yes. Hands of such skill they could turn stone to silk. Your body could suffer no knot they can't untangle.

52.speaker: Mamzell Amira
52.text: They're through the curtain to the right.

66.speaker: Mamzell Amira
66.text: You'll need coin and stamina in abundance to enjoy their services - but the gold will be as well-spent as you are.

68.speaker: Mamzell Amira
68.text: They're occupied at the moment, but come back later - they'll want to explore every part of you.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Are there other options for... companionship?

47.speaker: Mamzell Amira
47.text: Well, there's Naoise, our lovely nymph - but she'll be in no state for companionship. Not after... not after what happened.

78.speaker: Mamzell Amira
78.text: Naoise, our lovely nymph - but she's engaged in the Nymph's Grotto on the top floor, sweeting.

1.speaker: Mamzell Amira
1.text: The client's a favourite of hers, too. I doubt you'll be able to tear her away.

35.speaker: Mamzell Amira
35.text: But we are blessed to have a devil in residence at the moment - a temporary guest, but he asked that I send any potential clients his way.

85.speaker: Mamzell Amira
85.text: Everyone who's paid a visit looks quite changed by the experience.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I found Ffion's corpse. She's been murdered.

8.speaker: Mamzell Amira
8.text: Murdered? Ye gods, the poor thing. By the Mother of Cats, I pray she didn't suffer.

53.speaker: Mamzell Amira
53.text: I'll miss that face. Hells, the regulars will miss her more. They swarmed her like honeybees at the hive.

6.speaker: Mamzell Amira
6.text: *Sigh.* Losing Ffion's slashed a big hole in my coinpurse. I should get to replacing her.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: A woman is dead, and you're concerned about money?

44.speaker: Mamzell Amira
44.text: Sweeting, this is Baldur's Gate. I've seen more murders than a butcher's right eye.

42.speaker: Mamzell Amira
42.text: There will be time for tears. Cruel as it is, I must turn my mind to business - or more precisely, the lack of it.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Surely you can spare a reward for this information?

62.speaker: Mamzell Amira
62.text: I have little coin - but I offer sin in abundance.

82.speaker: Mamzell Amira
82.text: Talk with the drow twins in the taproom. They're legends among the regulars. Almost myths. Tell them they're your gift from the Mamzell - and let them show you why.

21.speaker: Mamzell Amira
21.text: Our drow twins make a salacious coupling - but they're sadly occupied. Come by later; I'd hate for you to miss out.

14.speaker: Mamzell Amira
14.text: They're legends among the regulars. Almost myths. Tell them they're your gift from the Mamzell - and let them show you why.

10.speaker: Mamzell Amira
10.text: Anything else on your mind, sweeting?

60.speaker: Mamzell Amira
60.text: I can spare a little something - and a smile. I hope you can make do.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I'm sure you can spare a little something for me, at least.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: In the Flophouse lies a fresh-killed corpse: a lady dwarf. Could that be Ffion?

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Did the devil give you its name?

79.speaker: Mamzell Amira
79.text: Exceedingly handsome, and with a voice that could make the foulest blasphemy seem the sweetest hymn.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Can we not talk about this?

63.speaker: Mamzell Amira
63.text: Sweeting, are you blushing? There is no shame in pleasure. Even less when the pleasure is pain.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: You've misjudged me terribly - she'll need three costume changes minimum.

25.speaker: Mamzell Amira
25.text: Oh, you crave a performance... How decadent.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: My sole desire is to dominate the world over and leave it trembling beneath my feet.

64.speaker: Mamzell Amira
64.text: One of those, are you? There's plenty of room for roleplay in our establishment.

54.speaker: Mamzell Amira
54.text: If you have a change of heart and wish to be subdued, it's Ffion you should speak to when she comes back.

26.speaker: Mamzell Amira
26.text: Alas, we might struggle to restrain you if we tried, as our 'Stern Librarian' Ffion recently passed on.

67.speaker: Mamzell Amira
67.text: A drow or a drink, sweeting? There is no thirst I cannot quench.
